snippet: Some college-bound children of illegal immigrants have been denied resident tuition and financial aid, but New Jersey and Florida courts have recently made it more difficult for states to discriminate.
abstract: Florida federal court becomes the latest to limit the measures state officials can take to deny low tuition rates and financial aid to American citizens who are the children of illegal immigrants; strategy, which often prevents such students from attending state schools, has quietly proliferated as a cost cutting measure in states facing financial difficulties in recent years.
lead_paragraph: Some college-bound children of illegal immigrants have been denied resident tuition and financial aid, but New Jersey and Florida courts have recently made it more difficult for states to discriminate.

headline.seo: Florida and New Jersey Courts Aid Illegal Immigrants’ College-Bound Children
headline.main: Court Rulings Help Illegal Immigrants’ College-Bound Children
headline.print_headline: Court Rulings Help Illegal Immigrants’ College-Bound Children
